name: Trust for Public Land ParkScore® Index Data
description: This dataset, sourced from the Trust for Public Land ParkScore® Index, provides detailed information on public parks in cities across the United States. It includes variables such as park acreage, investment, accessibility, amenities, and equity. These data points are crucial for understanding the relationship between park access and community health indicators.

variableMeasured.name: Rank
variableMeasured.description: The overall rank of the city/state based on park metrics.

variableMeasured.name: MedianParkSizePoints
variableMeasured.description: Points assigned based on the median size of parks in the city/state.

variableMeasured.name: ParklandPoints
variableMeasured.description: Points assigned based on the percentage of land area dedicated to parks.

variableMeasured.name: AcreagePoints
variableMeasured.description: Points assigned based on the total acreage of parkland.

variableMeasured.name: 10MinWalkPoints
variableMeasured.description: Points for the percentage of residents within a 10-minute walk to a park.

variableMeasured.name: POC10MinWalkPoints
variableMeasured.description: Points for people of color within a 10-minute walk to a park.

variableMeasured.name: LowIncome10MinWalkPoints
variableMeasured.description: Points for low-income individuals within a 10-minute walk to a park.

variableMeasured.name: POCParkSpacePoints
variableMeasured.description: Points assigned for the equity of park space allocation for people of color.

variableMeasured.name: EquityPoints
variableMeasured.description: Overall points assigned for equity in park access.

variableMeasured.name: SpendingPoints
variableMeasured.description: Points for park-related spending per resident.

citation: Trust for Public Land, ParkScore® Index 2022
